Description:
American Single 2 of 3
Tuesday, February 12⋅9:00 – 11:00pm
Description:

American Single 

Tickets: $7 General Admission at the door
All shows start at 9 pm



**ARTIST FAVORITE AWARD WINNER AT RVK FRINGE 2018**

Swipe right for American Single! Two strangers (one single American girl + one volunteer from the audience) transition from “It’s a Match!” to their first date within a matter of minutes. It’s awkward, it’s taboo, and it is definitely a funny story you’ll be telling your friends later. 

This is an award winning, audience-interactive show, that exists on the border between stand-up, improv, and performance art. Olivia invites the audience to open their phones (and hearts!) by matching with her through a popular dating app, then takes one lucky suitor up onto the stage where they have a REAL FIRST DATE in front of a live audience-- an audience which is offering their every thought and criticism of the date via live poll.  Will they find love? Intimacy? Another one night stand? Every first date is different and entirely unpredictable.

American Single bravely explores the space between the personal and the private, while challenging its viewers to step out of their comfort zones in the name of true love. Can a real, honest connection be found under such artificial circumstances? American Single ventures to find out. 

Reviews

"Question your online dating choices, question your dating habits, but don’t question if you want to see this show. American Single is always a match!"
- Jessica LoMonaco, Fringe Co-Director

"Like watching a bus full of clowns crash into a firework factory: a disaster but still colorful and immensely funny."
- Ingimar Bjarni, Reykjavik Fringe


The Footlight Bar NYC
465 Seneca Ave (off the Seneca M or the Dekalb L) 


Instagram: @American.Single

Summary: Randy's Got A Playdough Face, Fire On TV, Goodnight Ghost, TBA
Description:
Randy's Got A Playdough Face, Fire On TV, Goodnight Ghost, TBA


Doors at 8. $10






TV On Fire is an American indie rock band formed in Brooklyn in 2016. The group is composed of vocalist Samantha Tannehill, guitarist Christian Martinez, bassist Remi Pyrdol, keyboardist Sylvester Pyrdol, and drummer Olivier Bedecarrax. 
Having started their musical journey in different parts of the world namely France, Poland, Colombia and the US, each member brings a unique combination of talent, experience and sound. Remi, Sylvester and Christian have previously collaborated on projects ranging from punk rock to electronic music. Olivier comes from the underground scene in France, where he played for a number of years. Last but not least, Sam has previously sung in singer-songwriter and rock bands in Texas where she gained experience pushing her vocal range. When it is all put together, TV On Fire produces an impressive and diverse indie rock sound.

The Saga continues at the Footlight bar at 9PM on March 26th! Tickets only 7$! Join us, oh hero! The Emblem calls you to GREATNESS!


Join us, Hero-to-be and take part in the greatest story ever told, The Saga of the Shining Emblem! This is a once-in-a-lifetime, improvised storytelling experience where YOU are the hero! One lucky audience member will be chosen to quest for the Emblem! Guided by one actor playing both Narrator and every character they happen to encounter, anything and everything can happen! Will you claim the Emblem and save the world? Or join with the darkness? The choice is yours! All accompanied by a live score!

Summary: Undiscovered Countries presents The Confessing Animal
Description:
Undiscovered Countries: The Confessing Animal - March with Undiscovered Countries. 

Doors at 7:30, show at 8 PM. 
FREE 

Undiscovered Countries is a Brooklyn-based incubator of new and developing interdisciplinary art. We present subversive and accessible work by artists lacking conventional support to foster a diverse, engaged community. Our shows at the Infinite Fest are free to artists and audiences alike. 


This month we're excited to present:  

Untitled Joan of Arc Piece by Kate Sonell and Seth Manjnoon
Barbara Begley Reads Love Poems About Friends of Hers Who Don't Know She Wrote Love Poems About Them, and Who May or May Not Be In This Room At This Very Moment
Eating My Feelings by Mary Rose Go
Disforia, a film by Lio Mehiel
Group Texts and other things I'm irrationally afraid of by Teshale Nuer
there's a shewolf by Sarah Sanders
untitled work by Rebecca vineyard

Comedian Anders Lee brings his Edinburgh show back to NYC. Diagnosed at a young age with autistic spectrum disorder, Lee dives headfirst into questions of education, social cues and what it means, in our hyper-capitalist, technology saturated era, to truly be dumb.

★★★★
